questions: How many planets are there in the solar system?
How many planets orbit the Sun?
What is the total count of planets in our solar system?
answers: There are eight planets in the solar system.
The solar system consists of eight planets.
There are a total of eight planets orbiting the Sun.

questions: What are the names of the planets in our solar system?
Can you list the planets in our solar system?
Name all the planets in our solar system.
List out the names of the planets orbiting the Sun.
answers: The planets in our solar system are Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.
In our solar system, we have Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.
The planets of our solar system include Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.
Our solar system comprises Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.

questions: Which planet is closest to the Sun?

Identify the planet nearest to the Sun.

answers: Mercury is the planet closest to the Sun.
The closest planet to the Sun is Mercury.
Mercury is the nearest planet to the Sun.
The planet closest to the Sun is Mercury.

questions: What is the largest planet in our solar system?

answers: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system.

questions: Which planet has the most moons?

answers: Jupiter has the most moons of any planet in our solar system.

Jupiter boasts the largest number of moons among all planets in our solar system.

questions: What is the farthest planet from the Sun?

answers: Neptune is the farthest planet from the Sun.

questions: Is Pluto considered a planet?
What is Pluto's classification?
Is Pluto still regarded as a planet?
answers: Pluto is no longer considered a planet, it is classified as a dwarf planet.
Pluto has been reclassified as a dwarf planet and is no longer considered one of the planets in our solar system.
Pluto's status as a planet has been revoked, and it is now classified as a dwarf planet.
